quest.name: In Search of the Azure Star
journal: You speak with Jude, the sole member of the Classical Astronomer's Association, and learn he is distraught over a broken telescope. Shortly after divulging his ails to you, he tells you of his plans to build a new one. You agree to assist him, and he hastily rushes off to Noumenon with renewed enthusiasm, hoping to rectify the situation.
You speak with Jude who requests you to search for tomes detailing the manufacturing process of telescopes. With any luck, you will find documents suitable to both his needs and budget.
A thorough search of the shelves has yielded three rather promising tomes. It remains to be seen if their contents meet with Jude's approval, however.

Skimming through the books you provided, Jude eventually settles upon the starlens. Though still incredulous as to its efficacy, he cannot deny its affordability. With the matter decided, he bids you return with him to his workshop.

Jude explains to you his reasons for joining the Faculty of Astronomy. While faint of heart, he is unwilling to compromise on his dreams of finding the Azure Star he once saw with his childhood friend. With your crafting expertise and the starlens, perhaps there is a chance he will fulfill his heart's deepest desire.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Dear, oh dear. If only he were here to help...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Eep! Goodness me! You gave me quite the scare. ...Do I know you?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Ahem. I must apologize. As you've likely already gathered, I am rather easily startled.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Is aught amiss?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I heard you have work for me.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. You see, I, Jude, belong to the Faculty of Astronomy and am enlisted in the Classical Astronomer's Association.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: ...Despite the name, I am the sole member. Until this last year we were far more in number, but the other students graduated just as I joined.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: “Why remain a part of an association that, but for my efforts, is obsolete?” you might ask.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: The reason is quite simple. I thought it would allow me free access to their telescope!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Recently, however, the Faculty of Astronomy and all its constituents─the Classical Astronomer's Association included─have been urged by the Forum to contribute to a national project. As a result, I am unable to use the telescope at my own discretion.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: If only my problems ended there! After I had taken over the association's activities, I came to learn the telescope was not only old but in a state of total disrepair!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: I have, of course, since attempted to have it repaired, but no craftsman is willing to accept my request...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Impatience has led me to attempt to restore it myself. All I've accomplished is making the situation worse...beyond recovery, even.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: ...Ah, my apologies! I've started to ramble.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: So you're a craftsman that's been sent by Qih Aliapoh?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: I am terribly sorry. Despite having come all this way, there is no longer any telescope to restore.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Well, if there is no telescope that needs repairing...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Why not just make a new one?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Indeed! The possibility had not even crossed my mind...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Oh, what I wouldn't give for one of those new lenses I've heard so much about. Their precision and clarity is said to be without peer! But the funding required would be astronomical...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Perhaps if we forgo the latest and greatest in telescope components, the modest budget I've received from the association may suffice to make one.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: I best get to work, then! Noumenon will no doubt have a plethora of information on the subject of crafting telescopes!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: While I have an acute fear of crowded places, my desire to look upon the stars is enough to see me through the task! ...Or so I hope.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Jude rushes off. His last words still ringing in your head, you take off in the direction of Noumenon after him.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Oh! You're here to lend me a hand in searching for the necessary tomes?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: ...Thank you. Only one other person has ever extended to me such kindness!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Eighty-seven point ninety-six percent of those I've encountered have approached me, words dripping with honey, looking only to take advantage of my purse strings.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: But enough about that! Somewhere among these tomes are documents detailing the intricacies of telescopes. Let us split up and search for them!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Please, should you find any relevant documents bring them to me!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Hmm, it's not this... Nor is it this...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Did you stumble across any leads?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: To think that you've managed to find three whole tomes! Excellent work! Let's have a look, shall we?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: ...A History of Observatories? This appears to be all about observatories and the massive telescopes they boast.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: While the content contained within these pages is near perfect, to create the telescope detailed here would require a budget on par with a national project...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Let us now take a look at The Encyclopedia of Astronomical Telescopes.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: What a treasure of a tome! It outlines the entirety of how telescopes are made, down to the smallest of details.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, we have only enough gil to cover a fraction of the cost of the parts listed here...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Let us see what this last one has to offer. ...An Astronomer's Comprehensive Overview of the Starlens, huh?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Starlens? I've never heard of such a thing... According to this, it is an ancient tool used by astronomers to read the stars and can be produced at a reasonable cost.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: But what good would such an ancient tool accomplish in today's world of astronomy and optics? It doesn't even use a lens! Then again...it is within my means.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Might I ask you to craft one for me? While I can only offer you the meager stipend our association receives from the Studium in exchange, I hope you'd consider it.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: You have my sincerest of thanks! Now then, there is little time to waste. I have already requested to use the space, so let us make our way to the workshop!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: According to my calculations, we should have just enough in the way of funds to craft a starlens.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: The question that remains, however, is if it will be powerful enough to aid me in my pursuit... <sigh> If only he were here...

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: (-???-)If it isn't Jude! You're looking gloomy as ever!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Eek! Wh-Who's there!?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you Jeromere. Have you finally decided to join the Faculty of Astronomy?

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: I know not to which Jeromere you're referring, but this one shines brighter than any of those so-called stars you gaze upon!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: You're the only Jeromere I know... You should know that seeing as we've been friends since childhood...

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: Jude, I'm terribly disappointed. Ten whole years have passed since we first met. I had thought you'd grow out of it eventually, yet you insist on immersing yourself in this tedious, unrewarding work!

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: We are pupils of the Studium. It is all but blasphemy to whittle away the best of your years, nose stuck between dusty old tomes!

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: Now why don't you set aside your wayward aspirations and join me in the Faculty of Literature? We might even be able to fetch you a decent-looking bride!

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: I've recently joined the “Poetry Lovers” club. We speak on love and life whilst sipping the finest of teas─does that not sound pleasurable to you?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Jeromere... Was it not you who introduced me to the wonders of astronomy? What made you lose interest in the subject?

dialogue.name: JEROMERE
dialogue.text: That is neither here nor there! I'm simply worried you're wasting away here, all on your own! ...Just promise me you'll think on it, all right?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: What's your relationship to him?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: ...Was that your friend?

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Ah, I must apologize for not introducing you. That was Jeromere─a childhood friend of mine.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Ever since I could remember, we would spend our nights together gazing up at the stars.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: It was a decade ago when it happened. The two of us took part in an astronomer's workshop. One night, when we were looking up at the night sky, we spotted a mysterious blue light.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Concluding it was an unidentified celestial body, we immediately notified the Studium's Faculty of Astronomy.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: No matter how much they searched, they were unable to find the light we had seen. In the end, the Studium chalked it up to the ramblings of imaginative schoolchildren.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Out of sheer frustration, we decided to join the Faculty of Astronomy, vowing to one another that we'd one day rediscover the azure body we saw that day.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Jeromere, being a summer older than I, enrolled first. When I finally entered, it was as though he were a different person─all vestiges of the old Jeromere and the promise we made one another, forgotten.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: I joined this faculty hoping to fulfill our dream of the decade prior. Yet, ever timid and easily cowed, I do not see how I will accomplish this alone...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: It was Jeromere always leading the way. Without him, I am lost...

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: You're not alone.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: You've got me.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Get a hold of yourself!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: You are right. With your help, perhaps there is still hope...

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: I do not know what I can do or how far I will get, but I must at least try.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Aaah! Please, do not be upset!

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: ...I do not know what I can do or how far I will get, but I suppose I must at least try.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Thank you very much. You've done so much for me already, but I have yet to even ask your name.

dialogue.name: JUDE
dialogue.text: Forename! I am looking forward to working with you!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now undertake deliveries for the Faculty of Astronomy at the Studium. Speak to Jude to learn more.
